Detailed Description

CByteImage for images with 8 bits per pixel, last updated 1/30/2002.

Very fast pixel access. Origo always (0,0).

This class is part of the Image Processing Library IPL98.

Version:
1.42, by edr@mip.sdu.dk
Author:
René Dencker Eriksen

Constructor & Destructor Documentation

ipl::CByteImage::CByteImage (  UINT32    Width,
UINT32    Height,
UINT32    Color = 0
) 
 

Constructor for empty image, allocates memory.

ROI is inactivated. All pixel values are initialised to 0.

Parameters:
Width  The width of image in pixels
Height  The height of image in pixels
Color  Initial color value in all pixels. Defaults to 0. The function is faster when Color initializes to 0.

All pixel values are initialised to 0. ROI is inactivated.

Parameters:

Height  The height of image in pixels
Bits  Number of bits per pixel, must be 8.
Color  Initial color value in all pixels. Defaults to 0. The function is faster when Color initializes to 0.
Returns :
False, if allocation failed or if "Bits" is not 8 b/p.

bool ipl::CByteImage::CopyConvert (  UINT16    Bits,
CStdImage &    SourceImage
)  [virtual]
 

Copies a whole image to "this" object and convert the pixel depth, if the new bits per pixel is the same as source image b/p the "="-operator is used.

For a CByteImage the destination can only be 8 b/p. Convertion from 1 to 8 b/p assumes black as 0-values and 1 as white values in the source image. For 24 to 8 b/p the mean value of the R, G and B component is used, i.e. the new image is a gray tone. If you want the resulting image placed in the source image just use the same object as parameter SourceImage. Note: In this case the function is a bit slower (needs to copy a temporary image to the destination). To optimize speed let pSource and pDest be different variables, the function is even faster if pDest has same dimensions as pSource! In that case no reallocation of destination image is needed.

Parameters:
Bits  Bits per pixel for the new image contained in "this" object.
SourceImage  Image to copy and convert from. The SourceImage is left unchanged.
Returns :
False, if source image is empty or if Bits is not 8.

Implements ipl::CStdImage.

Definition at line 402 of file byte_image.cpp.

References ipl::CText::AppendIPL(), TImage::FileInfo, ipl::CStdImage::GetBits(), ipl::CStdImage::GetConstTImagePtr(), ipl::CStdImage::m_History, ipl::CStdImage::m_Image, TFileInfo::PathAndFileName, TString::pChars, and ipl::CText::RemoveLastLine().

bool ipl::CByteImage::CopySubImage (  CStdImage &    SourceImage,
const CPoint2D< int > &    UpperLeft,
const CPoint2D< int > &    LowerRight
) 
 

Copies a CStdImage to this image.

The positions (xmin,ymin) and (xmax,ymax) specifies the rectangle to be copied including the specified values. The method uses integers because of origo offset which may force the user to use values less than zero. If you want the resulting image placed in this image just use the same object for SourceImage. Note: In that case the method is a bit slower (needs to copy a temporary image to the destination). Adds new line to history.

Parameters:
UpperLeft  position in the upper left corner to start from.
LowerRight  position in the lower left corner to stop at.
Returns :
false if outside image, or the source image does not have 8 b/p

Reimplemented from ipl::CStdImage.

bool ipl::CByteImage::CopySubImage (  CStdImage &    SourceImage,
int    xmin,
int    ymin,
int    xmax,
int    ymax
) 
 

Copies a CStdImage to this image.

The positions (xmin,ymin) and (xmax,ymax) specifies the rectangle to be copied including the specified values. The method uses integers because of origo offset which may force the user to use values less than zero. If you want the resulting image placed in this image just use the same object for SourceImage. Note: In that case the method is a bit slower (needs to copy a temporary image to the destination). Adds new line to history.

Parameters:
xmin  defines left side of rectangle in source image to copy from (including this value).
ymin  defines top side of rectangle in source image to copy from (including this value).
xmax  defines right side of rectangle in source image to copy from (including this value).
ymax  defines buttom side of rectangle in source image to copy from (including this value).
Returns :
false if outside image, or the source image does not have 8 b/p

bool ipl::CByteImage::Load (  const char *    pPathAndFileName )  [virtual]
 

Loads file of type given by extension from disk.

ROI is inactivated. At the moment the following formats are supported: BMP: The windows BMP format in 1, 8 and 24 bits per pixel. PGM: Portable Gray Map, only in binary format (P5) and with 255 gray tones. History present in comment lines is loaded into the TImage.History variable.

Parameters:
pPathAndFileName  Name of file including extension and relative or absolute path, f.ex. absolut path "c:/temp/doggie.bmp", relative "doggie.bmp". Both slash ("/") and back slash ("\") can be used in the path. There is no differense between upper and lower case characters, they are treated equally.
Returns :
false if load failed

Implements ipl::CStdImage.

Definition at line 303 of file byte_image.cpp.

References ipl::CText::AddDate(), ipl::CText::AddTime(), ipl::CText::AppendCText(), ipl::CText::AppendIPL(), TImage::Bits, ipl::CStdImage::m_History, ipl::CStdImage::m_Image, ipl::CStdImage::m_Pal, m_ppPixel, ipl::CGenericImage::m_ROIActive, TImage::Pal, TString::pChars, TImage::ppMatrix, and ipl::CPalette::SetPalettePtr().

Referenced by Load().

CByteImage & ipl::CByteImage::operator= (  const CByteImage &    SourceImage ) 
 

Overloading of assignment operator (width a CStdImage).

Accepts 8 b/p source images only. All information is copied to the destination image including border pixels, palette, ROI and history. Previous data in this object are destroyed. Origin is set to RAM. File information is left empty. The operator is fastest if this object has same dimensions as SourceImage! In that case no reallocation of destination image is needed. An error is produced if both sides of the assignment operator is the same object.

Definition at line 74 of file byte_image.cpp.

References ipl::CText::AppendIPL(), ipl::CStdImage::GetConstTImagePtr(), ipl::CText::GetItem(), ipl::CStdImage::GetOrigin(), TImage::History, ipl::CStdImage::m_History, ipl::CStdImage::m_Image, ipl::CStdImage::m_Pal, m_ppPixel, ipl::CGenericImage::m_ROIActive, ipl::CGenericImage::m_ROILowerRight, ipl::CGenericImage::m_ROIUpperLeft, TImage::Pal, TString::pChars, TImage::ppMatrix, ipl::CText::RemoveLastLine(), ipl::CPalette::SetPalettePtr(), ipl::CText::SetTextPtr(), and ipl::CText::TotalItems().

CByteImage & ipl::CByteImage::operator= (  const CStdImage &    SourceImage ) 
 

Overloading of assignment operator (width a CByteImage).

Accepts 8 b/p source images only. All information is copied to the destination image including border pixels, palette, ROI and history. Previous data in this object are destroyed. Origin is set to RAM. File information is left empty. Origo is set to (0,0) indepently of source origo. The operator is fastest if this object has same dimensions as SourceImage! In that case no reallocation of destination image is needed. Adds new line to history. An error is produced if both sides of the assignment operator is the same object.

Reimplemented from ipl::CStdImage.

bool ipl::CByteImage::SetPixel (  int    x,
int    y,
UINT32    Color
)  [inline, virtual]
 

Sets a pixel at position (x,y), including range check, slow access.

Parameters:
x  The position in horisontal direction.
y  The position in vertical direction.
Color  The new pixel value, a palette index value.
Returns :
false if outside image

int    y,

)  [inline, virtual]
 

Sets a pixel at position (x,y), without range check, fast access.

Parameters:
x  The position in horisontal direction.
y  The position in vertical direction.
Color  The new pixel value, for 24 b/p images an RGB value, otherwise a palette index value.

Implements ipl::CStdImage.

Definition at line 535 of file byte_image.h.

References m_ppPixel.

bool ipl::CByteImage::SetROI (  const CPoint2D< INT32 > &    UL,
const CPoint2D< INT32 > &    LR
)  [inline, virtual]
 

Sets Region Of Interest (ROI) for this object.

If outside image dimensions false is returned and an error is produced. In that case the state of ROI is left unchanged. Image dimensions are the values returned from the methods GetMinX(), GetMaxX(), GetMinY() and GetMaxY(), i.e. it includes origo offset.

Parameters:
UL  Upper left value of ROI, relative to origo.
LR  Lower right value of ROI, relative to origo.
Returns :
False, if values are outside image dimensions, relative to origo.

Implements ipl::CGenericImage.

Member Data Documentation

UINT8** ipl::CByteImage::m_ppPixel
 

pointer to pixels in image, indexing is by m_ppPixel[y][x].

This member can be used to both setting and getting pixels, but of course

  • no range check!
